intro: Morrenia stuckertiana subsp. grandiflora, commonly known as the giant morrenia, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often reaching several inches in diameter. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with thick, woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its vibrant floral display.
